fields.description: It should include a brief background justifying the study followed by research objectives, methodology and the expected outcomes. Description of the methodology should include the research design, sampling method and sample size, study area and any instruments that will be used.
fields.label: 1. Abstract (250-300 words)

fields.description:
This provides the necessary context for the research problem. It briefly highlights the current status of the field and any major gaps in knowledge that need additional research. First, the research question should be placed in the context of a current, focused, and active research area (or if it’s an older area, explain why that is still a viable research topic). Second, provide some historical background, if any. Thirdly, discuss the modern context, wherein the research will be central. Finally, refer briefly to the most significant recent publications (the full literature review is separate).
The problem statement, which may be in the introduction in an appropriate place, serves to: (1) Introduce the reader to the importance of the problem. The reader is oriented to the significance of the study and the research questions or hypotheses to follow; (2) Place the problem in a context; (3) Provide the framework for reporting the results; and (4) Indicate what is probably necessary to conduct the study and explain how the findings will present this information.
fields.label: 2. Background and Problem Statement (250-300 words):

fields.description: List the specific research questions you intend to address or the hypotheses you plan to test.
fields.label: 3. Research Questions or Hypotheses (50-100 words):

fields.description: Should answer the question: “What am I going to do?” Think high level, but make each aim an achievable objective, not a best effort, one with clear endpoints peer reviewers can easily assess. Objectives should be somewhat independent of each other. Check that: (1) My Specific Objectives can test my hypothesis; (2) They are doable within the grant period I am requesting. (3)The objectives are concrete and well- focused. (4) I can define endpoints my peer reviewers will be able to assess.
fields.label: 4. Research Objectives:

fields.description: This demonstrates to yourself and reviewers that you understand your field, and you have the background knowledge to move forward. Most research is incremental: if you cannot find literature on research that is very similar to yours, you have not looked hard enough. Give historical context, but keep the bulk of this section focused on recent advances (less than 10 years old). Sum up this section with a brief statement of the unknowns in this field, and hint at how your research will address these gaps.
fields.label: 5. Literature Review (500-600 words)

fields.description: Discuss the fundamental framework and guiding principle(s) that shape the researcher's philosophical perspective, methodology choices, and approach to understanding and investigating the particular subject or phenomenon.
fields.label: 6.1. Research Design:

fields.description: Describe the sampling method to be employed including the selection of research site(s), sampling methods, inclusion criteria and inclusion criteria, sample size and analysis tools with adequate justification.
fields.label: 6.2 Sampling Design

fields.description: Explain the systematic process for gathering the data required to address research questions or achieve objectives.
fields.label: 6.3 Data Collection Tools and Procedures

fields.description: Explain the systematic data analysis procedures including how the analysis tools/tests will be used.
fields.label: 6.4	Data Analysis Tools and Procedures

fields.description: Explain how the research results and findings will be presented to communicate the key insights (e.g., graphs, tables, etc.).
fields.label: 6.5 Data Presentation

fields.description: Statement on the ethical conduct of the research – Indicate any and all potential ethical issues you may encounter. Give plans to avoid ethical dilemmas, or if they are encountered, how you will overcome them.
fields.label: 7. Ethical Consideration

fields.description: Plan to ensure the health and safety of members of the research team for work proposed which may be hazardous. Attach Health and Safety Forms
fields.label: 7.1. Statement on health and safety considerations, if necessary

fields.description: Explicitly state how you will follow best practices in your field (e.g., informed consent and anonymity). Attach the Research Ethics Clearance Form and the Informed Consent Forms.
fields.label: 7.2 Subject research

fields.description: Typically needs to document evidence that you will meet specific requirements for ethical conduct of animal research cognizant of Bhutanese values.
fields.label: 7.3. Other animal research

fields.description: Full disclosure of any potential conflicts of interest and plan to manage them (made in consultation with the CRC), or a statement that there are none.
fields.label: 8.	Statement on potential conflict of interest

fields.description: If collaborating partners are involved, the involvement, relative contribution, and plan for credit- sharing shall be given.
fields.label: 9. Role of collaborators and credit-sharing agreement (if any)

fields.description: Describe how the research findings shall be disseminated to key stakeholders and the broader scientific community, e.g., through journal publication, stakeholders’ presentations, conferences, seminars, or other means appropriate to your field.
fields.label: 10. Data Dissemination Plan:

fields.description: Provide an overview of the expected outcomes, innovation and contributions in relation to knowledge, policy and practices.
fields.label: 11. Research Impact (50-100 words):

fields.description: Mention if the project has research outcomes (product and services) that can be applied for IP.
fields.label: 12. Intellectual Property:

fields.description: Provide a breakdown of the expected costs associated with the research project. Include items such as research materials, participant compensation, travel, and any other relevant expenses and  indicate the overall time-frame for the research as well as phase-wise goal deadlines.
fields.label: Timeline and Budget
Research Title (Should be clear and concise)
